newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: KLAIPEDOS NAFTA Q1 NET PROFIT 9 MLN LITAS.
newsitem.headline: KLAIPEDOS NAFTA Q1 NET PROFIT 9 MLN LITAS.

text.p: Lithuanian oil terminal Klaipedos Nafta said on Wednesday its first quarter 1997 net profit was 9 million litas.
"We had a nine million litas net profit in the three months of this year," Elena Chernij, finance director, told Reuters.
Chernij said she could not provide comparative figures for last year since the reconstruction in the company was going on and reloading works were halted.
"All the first quarter profit profit will be used to pay interest rates for credits and further upgrading of the company," Chernij added.
The company is doing reconstruction work worth $120 million, expected to be ended in the first quarter of 1998.
"The whole profit of 1997 will be used to repay the credits and interest rates," Chernij said.
Chernij also said that the company will start repayment for the credits in the second quarter of this year.
State-run Naftos Terminalas ownes 46 percent of Klaipedos Nafta.
